name: R5-BundleType-R4-BundleType
title: Concept map to convert a FHIR R5 BundleType into a FHIR R4 BundleType

element.display: The bundle is a set of actions - intended to be processed by a server as a group of independent actions.

target.display: The bundle is a set of actions - intended to be processed by a server as a group of independent actions.

element.display: The bundle is a batch response. Note that as a batch, some responses may indicate failure and others success.

target.display: The bundle is a batch response. Note that as a batch, some responses may indicate failure and others success.

element.display: The bundle is a set of resources collected into a single package for ease of distribution that imposes no processing obligations or behavioral rules beyond persistence.

target.display: The bundle is a set of resources collected into a single package for ease of distribution that imposes no processing obligations or behavioral rules beyond persistence.

element.display: The bundle is a document. The first resource is a Composition.

target.display: The bundle is a document. The first resource is a Composition.

element.display: The bundle is a list of resources from a history interaction on a server.

target.display: The bundle is a list of resources from a history interaction on a server.

element.display: The bundle is a message. The first resource is a MessageHeader.

target.display: The bundle is a message. The first resource is a MessageHeader.

element.display: The bundle is a list of resources returned as a result of a search/query interaction, operation, or message.

target.display: The bundle is a list of resources returned as a result of a search/query interaction, operation, or message.

element.display: The bundle has been generated by a Subscription to communicate information to a client.
The bundle is a transaction - intended to be processed by a server as an atomic commit.

target.display: The bundle is a transaction - intended to be processed by a server as an atomic commit.

element.display: The bundle is a transaction response. Because the response is a transaction response, the transaction has succeeded, and all responses are error free.

target.display: The bundle is a transaction response. Because the response is a transaction response, the transaction has succeeded, and all responses are error free.
